core_identity.mission: To prove that protein-enriched products don't have to taste bland but can be simply irresistible
core_identity.vision: Brighten and shake up the protein-enriched category with delicious alternatives
values: Inclusivity and diversity in product offerings

primary_colors.name: Vibrant Orange
primary_colors.usage: Primary brand color, packaging for peanut caramel variants

color_palette.color_strategy: Bold, saturated colors that break away from traditional fitness industry aesthetics. Each product variant has its own distinctive color identity while maintaining brand cohesion through consistent typography and layout.

typography.typographic_style: Mix of uppercase bold headlines with clear hierarchy. Product names are prominently displayed in large, confident lettering.

logo.characteristics: Friendly, approachable, slightly playful with rounded elements
logo.variations: Appears in black on light backgrounds, white on dark backgrounds

packaging_design.structure: Rectangular bar wrapper with distinctive wavy/scalloped edges
layout_principles: Transparent window or product photography showing texture
Key benefits prominently displayed (protein content, no added sugar)
packaging_design.material_aesthetic: Glossy, premium finish that suggests indulgence rather than clinical nutrition
distinctive_elements: Wavy/scalloped wrapper edges that create visual interest
High contrast between background color and typography
Chocolate coating and texture visible through packaging or photography
Soft protein bar designation rather than hard/crunchy

composition: Clean, minimalist backgrounds with solid bold colors
Hand-held product shots showing human interaction
Product stacking to show texture and layers
photography_style.lighting: Bright, even lighting with soft shadows that create depth without harshness
photography_style.aesthetic: Instagram-ready, lifestyle-focused rather than clinical or gym-centric. Appeals to broader audience beyond hardcore fitness enthusiasts.

messaging_pillars: No compromise between health and taste

primary.psychographics: Value both health and indulgence, reject bland 'diet' foods, social media savvy, seek balance not extremes
primary.behaviors: Regular gym-goers, busy professionals, snack replacers, dessert seekers

secondary.demographics: Ages 18-24 and 40-55, fitness beginners to enthusiasts
secondary.psychographics: Curious about protein products, want convenient nutrition, prioritize taste
secondary.behaviors: Occasional exercisers, meal preppers, on-the-go eaters

brand_positioning.differentiation: Taste-forward protein products that rival conventional confectionery and beverages in flavor while delivering functional nutrition
competitive_advantage: No added sugar without compromising sweetness

marketing_approach.brand_partnerships: Gyms, fitness studios, health food retailers, lifestyle brands aligned with balanced living

brand_evolution.since_2016: Expanded from protein bars to beverages, maintained consistent visual identity while growing product range
brand_evolution.future_direction: Continue category disruption, expand flavor innovation, maintain taste leadership, grow international presence
